dialogues.speaker: Sara
dialogues.text: It's a strange feeling, returning home after such a long time.

dialogues.speaker: Robert
dialogues.text: I can only imagine. So many memories here.

dialogues.speaker: Narrator
dialogues.text: Looking around, Sara could see the remnants of her childhood. The old tree house, the long forgotten bike, each bringing back vivid memories.

dialogues.speaker: Sara
dialogues.text: I can't believe mom and dad kept everything the same.

dialogues.speaker: Robert
dialogues.text: They always hoped for your return, Sara. This place... It's still your home.

dialogues.speaker: Narrator
dialogues.text: And indeed it was. Despite the years spent away, she knew that her heart would always belong to this place, to this home.
